snippet: Tyson Foods said its net income was pulled down by debt-related charges and lower consumer demand for chicken and beef.
abstract: Tyson Foods says its net income was pulled down by debt-related charges and lower consumer demand for chicken and beef; reports fiscal third-quarter profit of $76 million, or 21 cents a share, down 61 percent from $196 million, or 51 cents a share, in the year-ago quarter; revenue was $8.31 billion from $8.25 billion.
lead_paragraph: Tyson Foods said its net income was pulled down by debt-related charges and lower consumer demand for chicken and beef.

headline.seo: Lower Demand for Meat Hurts Tyson’s Results
headline.main: Lower Demand for Meat Weighs on Tyson’s Results
headline.print_headline: Lower Demand for Meat Weighs on Tyson’s Results
